Authors: Kurniawan A., Mulyono K., Mellyna, Gerardo S.
Title: E-resources geographic information system system for military operation
Affiliations: Department of Information Technology, Faculty of Computer Science, Binus University, Jakarta Barat, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Kurniawan, A., Department of Information Technology, Faculty of Computer Science, Binus University, Jakarta Barat, Indonesia; Mulyono, K., Department of Information Technology, Faculty of Computer Science, Binus University, Jakarta Barat, Indonesia; Mellyna, Department of Information Technology, Faculty of Computer Science, Binus University, Jakarta Barat, Indonesia; Gerardo, S., Department of Information Technology, Faculty of Computer Science, Binus University, Jakarta Barat, Indonesia
Abstract: Nowadays, the barometer of the strength of a country is a military force that is owned by the state. To produce a good military force in a country, it would require an easy, fast and accurate military resource management. This study utilized geographic data as a reference for the location of the logistics resources to help simplify the management of military data using spatial data in Geographic Information System (GIS). The system development approach used JSON Service technology framework and HTML 5 to improve system performance. The features development of the management of military resources associated with military operations are conducted. Results of this study generate e-resource military operation system which is swift and in accordance with the W3C web standards. © 2013 Science Publications.
Author Keywords: E-resources; GIS; JSON service1; Military operation
